column4: Where do you install/put stand alone apps? Do you make a .file for them?
is it a single exec file or what?
- yes. Foxit Reader installs to just an executable & i noticed a .foxit dir in my home dir with a config file. Should I put the executable file in the .foxit dir??
no, put it in /usr/local/bin or /usr/bin -- it will find the config by itself
but make sure you chmod +x it so it will run!
how is it better than the native viewer in U?
how is foxit better than the Ubuntu reader?
- great question. I don't know, All I know is that ubuntu's default reader kept crashing on me. Literally every 10-20 minutes it would just crash
ok, one more Q: what version of Ubuntu?
- version 9.10. However, due to this, and some other issues, I'm now running 9.04 in the form of Mint (Please don't berate me)
ya, 9.10 is still kinda rough. I run 8.04/Mint Elyssa, cuz it's so stable.
- stability is important. Thanks a lot btw.
-- really quick. How do I access the file system dir in the terminal?
- i need to get to usr/bin
well, just 'cd /usr/bin'. You will need to use 'sudo' before any copy commands cuz /usr/bin is root access only.
